敬啟者：

本人於二零一九年六月十二日，於金鐘得悉大批警員對在場市民使用過度武力，甚至有警員沒有遵守警隊官方使用武力的指示，在未舉黑旗警告情況下，示威者頭部開槍鎮壓，當中最嚴重的傷者一度陷入昏迷，生命危殆。

根據《警察通例》有關使用武力的指引，警務人員除非有絕對必要，而且沒有其他辦法可完成合法任務，否則不得使用武力；使用前須表明身分，並在情况許可下盡量發出警告。

相信上述情況已違反《警察通例》的武力指引，有關的圖片及影片證據會以附件形式與電郵一同附上。

此外，根據二零一二年五月八日的立法會保安事務委員會——〈警方處理公眾集會及公眾遊行的事宜〉（立法會CB(2)1867/11-12(05)號文件）中曾提及胡椒噴霧的使用準則：

「當參與公眾集會或遊行人士以武力衝擊警方防線，而警方已採用可行方法，仍未能阻止示威者的有關行為時，警方可能會使用胡椒噴劑，以抵禦示威者的襲擊、或阻止示威者繼續衝擊警方的警戒線。警務人員如使用胡椒噴劑，須確保在符合使用最低程度武力的原則下方可使用。」


以上白紙黑字指出，胡椒噴霧須在示威者有武力威脅到警方的情況時，警員方可以胡椒噴霧制壓示威者，然而，有示威者在手上並沒有任何足以成為武器的工具時遭受噴霧攻擊。當中最嚴重的案例：有外國人士在示威現場中的花圃旁休息，疑似腳部受傷，舉手向警方示意沒有任何攻擊行為，並以英語表示自己行動不便。遺憾的是，警員依然手執防暴盾牌，非但沒有要幫助外藉人士的意思，甚至在受傷者的正前方臉噴灑胡椒噴霧。英語是香港的官方語言之一，香港警察貴為城市的守護者，理應通曉英語，以協助所有香港市民。有理由相信該警員如此的暴行，當中並沒有溝通不良的問題。

另外，《警察通例》第 39 章——〈警察與市民和傳播媒介的關係〉中，指出警方應配合傳媒工作，在事發現場的人員須：

(a) 以互諒互讓的態度，盡量配合傳媒工作；以及
(b) 不應妨礙傳媒的攝錄工作。

警方所使用的武力必須是為達到目的，而需使用的最低程度武力；達到目的後，須立即停止使用。警務人員亦要以互諒互讓的態度盡量配合傳媒工作，不應妨礙傳媒攝錄，可本人在二零一九年六月十二日透過傳媒直播得悉金鐘有多名警員暴力襲擊在場進行報導的記者，當記者出示證件或表明其記者的身份後，他們不但用粗言穢語辱罵記者，更使用胡椒噴霧，甚至布袋彈去進行驅趕，此舉不但完全違反警察通例，甚至妨礙香港的新聞自由。政務司司長張建宗於2018年的4月29日在香港最佳新聞獎頒獎典禮暨午餐會致辭中言之鑿鑿地表示：「特區政府高度重視、珍惜和全力維護法治精神、司法獨立，特別是新聞和言論自由，剛才已說這些是十分重要的，是香港的核心價值，是我們長期繁榮穩定的基石，特區政府施政會保持高透明度。」但如今警隊的行為卻與司長所言背道而馳，實是諷刺之極。望　貴局能對警隊中的害群之馬作出適當的紀律懲戒，方能保護特區政府的聲譽與未來發展。

而且，於二零一九年六月十四日的港鐵彩虹站內，有警員在阻止女途人的不合作運動過程中涉嫌非禮。影片中看到站在後方的警員粗暴地將女生拉到自己的身旁後，用右手觸摸及拍打她的右胸部。以及在二零一九年六月十二當日，多名警員拖行女示威者時，粗暴拖曳她的上衣，令她的衣服在眾目睽睽下幾乎脫落，露出內衣，此乃極度羞辱女性的行為，損害當事人的尊嚴。

上述的種種一切行為，均合理懷疑警察濫用權力、侵犯事主人身安全，損害涉嫌人士的尊嚴。香港警察是紀律部隊的一員，對香港法律比一般市民更有深入的瞭解，卻知法犯法，　貴局不應寬容任何危害警隊聲譽的成員。有關上述指控的影片及圖片證據將以附件形式在電郵後文附上，望　貴局能強烈譴責有關警員。

　　此致
公務員事務局局長

　　市民
＿＿（你個名）＿＿敬啟
二零一九年＿月＿日
辛苦哂巴打

To Chief of Civil Service Bureau, and whom it may concern,

I was informed a large portion of policemen had performed abuse of force and power against citizens on 12th June 2019. Some policemen failed to follow the weapon usage instructions given to the police force, and fired against a protester’s forehead without making announcement via raising the black banner. The protester was injured severely and was once in a coma, with life-threatening state. Apart from that, some of the policemen refused to say their names and UI number when the protesters asked for it.

According to the instructions of use of force in “Police General Orders”, physical force shall not be constructed unless there is inevitable necessity while any other means of completing the mission is unable to be acquired. It also indicates identity of police force shall be revealed, and warnings shall be given before the usage of power.

The occasion mentioned can be seen as a violation of instructions of use of force in “Police General Orders”. The attached are the related photos and videos as evidences.

In addition, according to The Use of Pepper Spray Instructions in Police's handling of public meetings and public processions(LC Paper No. CB(2)1867/11-12(05)) which was published by the Panel on Security of Legislative Council on 8th May 2012, it clearly states pepper spray shall not be used to regulate protesters unless the force of protesters is threatening the police force.

“When participants of public meetings or processions start charging the police defence line by using force, and police officers are unable to control the protestors’ aggression after exhausting practicable options, the police may resort to the use of OC foam to defend attack from protestors, or to prevent protestors from charging the police cordon line. When police officers use OC foam, they have to ensure that OC foam is used in compliance with the principle of using minimum force.”

However, attacking against armless protesters is presented in many of the photos and videos. Among these, the most severe case is about attacking an armless foreign citizen who already declared his disability to move because of legs injury. He also raised his hands to clarify he had no intention to attack. However, it is disappointing that instead of helping the injured foreigner, the policeman insisted on holding his riot shield, and sprayed pepper spray against the foreigner. This act is totally unacceptable and intolerable. it seems that the policeman did not understand the foreigner’s saying. As the law enforcement of Hong Kong, all the policemen should equip with the language competency of English which is one of the official languages in Hong Kong in order to provide assistance to all the Hong Kong citizens.

Other than that, according to Chapter 39 in “Police General Orders” – “Working with Media Representatives”, it indicates police force needs to cooperate with the press with the instructions as follows:

(a) facilitate the work of the news media as much as possible and accord
media representatives consideration and courtesy; and
(b) not block camera lenses.


However, I was told there are numerous policemen committed violent assault on the reporters who were going on live in the scene. After the reporters had shown their press certificate, the police force not only used foul language to curse the journalists, but also used pepper spray and even bean bag round to evacuate them. Such act is a serious violation of “Police General Orders”, and also an obstruction of the press freedom in Hong Kong. The Chief Secretary for Administration, Matthew Cheung Kin-chung, in 2018 Hong Kong News Award stated with certainty that “Hong Kong is a veritable media hub, with about 80 newspapers and more than 80 bases set up by leading media organizations around the world. I read 20 newspapers each day, it helps me and the government listen to the public’s opinions. The government highly respects and values the freedoms of the press and of speech, he said, adding that the media should play its watchdog role.” What had been performed by the police force is undoubtedly no where close to what the Chief had spoken. Punishments to those whose acts violates the principles mentioned is urged, for the sake of international image of the Hong Kong Government and its future development.

Besides, on 14th June 2019, a policeman had been caught on tape with sexual assult against a female during the process of stopping a non-cooperation in Choi Hung Station. From the video, he touched and tapped on her right chest when he was pulling the female citizen out from the MTR compartment. The act of touching her chest is totally unnecessary and can be avoided during the process of arrest. What the policeman did seems to be intentional and should be considered as sexual assault to the female protester. Similarly, another sexual assault was committed to a female protester on 12th June 2019 by policeman. The police force dragged the female protester rudely, causing her upper body and underwear exposed in front of the public.

All the acts mentioned above are the legitimate proof of abuse of power and invasion of personal security done by the police force. The Hong Kong Police Force, as a member of the discipline force, is expected to have in-depth understanding in the laws of Hong Kong better than Hong Kong citizens. The policemen mentioned above acted illegally with clear reference of the law. Such reputation-risking member should not be beared. All the videos and photos proving the above events are in the attached. The rules-breaking policemen should be punished, with intense urge.

Yours Faithfully,
Citizen,
_(name)
_(date)_ / _(month)_ / 2019
